intro: Fibigia afghanica, commonly known as the Afghan fibigia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to regions of Central and South Asia, including Afghanistan, Pakistan, and parts of India. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stem and small, clustered white or greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Fibigia afghanica is often found in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions.
